history.content:
https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/minor

I think D is technically a passing grade. However, you'll need, at least, an overall 2.0 GPA for the 7 requirements. The website also states each course should be taken with a letter grade, so although i'm not 100% sure, it seems PNP will not work to get the minor.

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/minor

I think D is technically a passing grade. However, you'll need, at least, an overall 2.0 GPA for the 7 requirements. The requirements also state each course should be taken with a letter grade, so although i'm not 100% sure, it seems PNP will not work to get the minor.

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/minor

I think D is technically a passing grade. However, you'll need an overall GPA of the 7 requirements of at least 2.0. The requirements also state each course should be taken with a letter grade, so although i'm not 100% sure, it seems PNP will not work to get the minor.

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/minor

I think D is technically a passing grade. However, you'll need an overall GPA of the 7 requirements of at least 2.0. The requirements also state each course should be taking with a letter grade, so although i'm not 100% sure, it seems PNP will not work to get the minor.
All minor requirements must be taken for a letter grade. P/NP the course will make you ineligible.
If I PNP 61C, can I get it counted as C- for the minor?
history.subject: CS Minor question
